授業目的: This course is designed for students who are interested in the issues of gender, ethnicity/race, and sexuality. Although resolution of these issues is important for those seeking happiness in their lives, they have never formed part of mainstream debate. During the class we will consider why this is the case through readings and discussion. The class will be conducted in a seminar format with students being expected to raise discussion points and to give presentations. The goal is to enable them to acquire basic concepts and to gain knowledge of related theories.
到達目標: To be aware of the unseen prejudice that surrounds us.
特記事項: 本授業科目は、“オンライン授業60単位制限対象科目”ではありません。 The course is not subject to the 60-credit limit for online courses.

第1回:
Week 1: Introduction to the class.
Face to face format for All 14 lectures.
第3回: Week 3: A brief history of the women’s movement.
第7回: Week 7: Sexual minorities in the media.
第8回: Week 8: Debate topics to be decided in class.
第11回: Week 11: Women in North America I.
第12回: Week 12: Women in North America II.
第14回: Week 14: Students’ final presentations and class evaluation
